resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete all decisions?
Description added! You can add another one in this square or fill another square! Also you can calculate your decision clicked on chart icon!
Add description and severity\n then click \"+\"
Please enter the name of decision!
Please enter description and set severity (from 1 to 5), then click \"+\"
What will be if it DOESN\'T happen?
What will be if it happens?
What WON\'T be if it DOESN\'T happen?
What WON\'T be if it happens?
Enter the question\n or a name of problem\n then click \"+\"

string.name: descarts_sqare_technique
string.p:
This technique “Descartes Square” allows to consider a question from four sides. You need to answer four questions for this:

1)	What will happen if it takes place?
2)	What will happen if it doesn’t take place?
3)	What will not happen if it takes place?
4)	What will not happen if it doesn’t take place?

In this way you will work up the solution to the question in all possible options.

How to use

First, choose point “Make a decision”. Then type question that you are interested in and press “+”. You will see square with four questions and a diagram. You can choose any question and start answering. Each answer has to be evaluated (how important it is for you) from 1 to 5; after you do it press “+”. The more answers you give the easier it will be to make a decision. After all or few squares will be filled in, you can press the diagram icon. You will see a diagrammatical result with more and less suitable options in percentage.
Later you can come back to your decisions by pressing “My decisions” in the main menu. If you choose one of decisions you will see Descartes Square again and after clicking each square you will see the list of your previous answers. You can also add answers to any square by pressing “+”.
You can delete all decisions by pressing “x” or edit/delete particular decision by durable press on it in “My decisions” menu. Options of deleting and editing are also present in each square in answers.

resources.string: The list of decisions is empty
